Day 26: Here's how I know I've been learning more than the technical physical techniques of yoga this journey. Sliding up into rockstar pose was _hard_. It was deeply confusing to figure out what I needed to do, and difficult to get my body to do it. I wasn't sure what was going on. I don't think I did it right. And I _didn't get angry about it_.

Not at myself; not at the practice. It was hard. I noted it, and I dealt with it--I breathed in, I paused the video, I tried it and then tried it again, and I did something that worked, mostly, more or less. It was pretty far from perfect. I'm not upset about that fact.

Just for that, this was all worth it. For the chance to be bad at something without fury. I'm so glad.
